item.title: jQuery Animate Body Scroll For All Browsers
item.description: It turns out that when trying to use jQuery’s animate to scrollTop on the main body of an html document different browsers require different targets to scroll to. Webkit requires targeting the body of the document while all other browsers that I know of use html. The typical solution is to target both in the same call: $('html, body').animate({ scrollTop: '0px','fast', function(){ // Code to be fired when complete goes here (fired twice) } }); This solution is problematic, however, because even though the scrollTop will only work once, the callback is fired twice.
